body:
I’m happy that mine have generally been good about this. I live in Massachusetts and in all of my years of schooling (gonna be a senior in 30 days) and I’ve only ever heard one political rant in the classroom and that was from my seventh grade science teacher during the 2016 primaries.

I’ve also tended to have a lot of older teachers who generally are a lot and a lot less left wing.

I’m personally a libertarian so I belong to the “I don’t give a shit, you do you” camp, so I’m fine if I have leftist teachers, even openly leftist teachers (like if they say who they voted for or something) as long as they don’t push propaganda and influence our opinions. That’s never happened in my classes, at least explicitly. I’m a little worried that we’ll have to talk about “racism” in the fall (of course likely in hybrid learning even though the virus has been fucking contained since Memorial Day because 🤡🌎) when as far as I’m aware, there’s little to none in the school (but I’m white, so I don’t really have a right to speak for my black classmates, I’d have to ask them).

Hopefully I never have to deal with left wing bullshit being pushed in college but I have no plans to go to a liberal arts school so it’s not likely.
body_html:
I’m happy that mine have generally been good about this. I live in Massachusetts and in all of my years of schooling (gonna be a senior in 30 days) and I’ve only ever heard one political rant in the classroom and that was from my seventh grade science teacher during the 2016 primaries.

I’ve also tended to have a lot of older teachers who generally are a lot and a lot less left wing.

I’m personally a libertarian so I belong to the “I don’t give a shit, you do you” camp, so I’m fine if I have leftist teachers, even openly leftist teachers (like if they say who they voted for or something) as long as they don’t push propaganda and influence our opinions. That’s never happened in my classes, at least explicitly. I’m a little worried that we’ll have to talk about “racism” in the fall (of course likely in hybrid learning even though the virus has been fucking contained since Memorial Day because 🤡🌎) when as far as I’m aware, there’s little to none in the school (but I’m white, so I don’t really have a right to speak for my black classmates, I’d have to ask them).

Hopefully I never have to deal with left wing bullshit being pushed in college but I have no plans to go to a liberal arts school so it’s not likely.

body: I think that’s dependent on who you’re working with. I know it sounds cliche, but there are all types of people out there- not all people can be classified into one single group. Public school teachers certainly aren’t in an exceptional line of work, but that doesn’t make them bad people.

body:

I had a few really excellent teachers, plenty of well enough (considering retrospectively government indoctrination), and a couple bad teachers. Some were lazy about some things.

post.title: Public school teachers are usually stupid, lazy and arrogant.

body:
Oh I know. They just announced that they “need more time” to develop plans for the school year and are reducing the required amount of days from 180 to 170, this is a load of shit because it’s been four and a half months already and there’s still a month to go. Absolute blatant disregard for the kids like me who mentally are broken and want to be in school and see their friends. I’ve been online reading politics and getting upset about it for so long in this time that I feel like my personality is slightly different, I had to quit. You see, I CAN’T do this for much longer, yet the union is selfish and lazy and they don’t care about the kids, so they may force me too. I think the development of children needs to be taken into account and it’s not at all, absolute fucking 🤡🌎.

Now instead of going back on August 26, we possibly go back anywhere from then until September 16, but if they shortened the school year it would likely start the Tuesday after Labor Day as we already would have had 12 days of school by that point instead of 10 so it’s not that much of a departure from the original time. We’re also helped by being closer to Worcester than Boston, and we’ve had plans ready since early July. We also live in one of the most conservative parts of the state but I really don’t think that helps much. It’s also not required to use the 10 days and I’m not sure if this shit is even set in stone yet. 

The scary thing in all of this is that if the teacher’s union gets what they want then there isn’t gonna be a senior year for me.

Sorry for the rant I just needed to get it out and I can’t on Reddit without having lefties downvote me. My whole family except my mom doesn’t get it and she’s asleep (my sister is a leftist and my dad isn’t one to listen to this).
body_html:
Oh I know. They just announced that they “need more time” to develop plans for the school year and are reducing the required amount of days from 180 to 170, this is a load of shit because it’s been four and a half months already and there’s still a month to go. Absolute blatant disregard for the kids like me who mentally are broken and want to be in school and see their friends. I’ve been online reading politics and getting upset about it for so long in this time that I feel like my personality is slightly different, I had to quit. You see, I CAN’T do this for much longer, yet the union is selfish and lazy and they don’t care about the kids, so they may force me too. I think the development of children needs to be taken into account and it’s not at all, absolute fucking 🤡🌎.

Now instead of going back on August 26, we possibly go back anywhere from then until September 16, but if they shortened the school year it would likely start the Tuesday after Labor Day as we already would have had 12 days of school by that point instead of 10 so it’s not that much of a departure from the original time. We’re also helped by being closer to Worcester than Boston, and we’ve had plans ready since early July. We also live in one of the most conservative parts of the state but I really don’t think that helps much. It’s also not required to use the 10 days and I’m not sure if this shit is even set in stone yet.

The scary thing in all of this is that if the teacher’s union gets what they want then there isn’t gonna be a senior year for me.

Sorry for the rant I just needed to get it out and I can’t on Reddit without having lefties downvote me. My whole family except my mom doesn’t get it and she’s asleep (my sister is a leftist and my dad isn’t one to listen to this).
